MetricDescription: An aggregate score indicating the overall cyber security posture of the organization. Refer US Government Agency CISA'a AWARE Score card
Target:
X % or higher, 
X % higher than previous period, 
X % increase over a defined period 

This assumes a higher score indicates better security posture.
Comment: This metric is also good for large companies with multiple divisions and want a way of scoring each sub unit
Source: CDM Program AWARE Scoring Fact Sheet

MetricDescription: % of the agency’s information system budget devoted to information security
Source: NIST: SP 800-55 Revision 1, Performance Measurement Guide for Information Security

MetricDescription: % of high vulnerabilities mitigated within organizationally defined time periods after discovery
Source: NIST: SP 800-55 Revision 1, Performance Measurement Guide for Information Security

MetricDescription: % of information system security personnel that have received security training
Target:
X % or higher, 
X % higher than previous period, 
X % increase over a defined period 

Higher is better
Source: NIST: SP 800-55 Revision 1, Performance Measurement Guide for Information Security

MetricDescription: % of new systems that have completed certification and accreditation prior to their implementation
Target:
X % or higher, 
X % higher than previous period, 
X % increase over a defined period 

Higher is better
Comment: Refer NIST SP 800-53 Control: CA-6: Security Accreditation
Source: NIST: SP 800-55 Revision 1, Performance Measurement Guide for Information Security

MetricDescription: % approved and implemented configuration changes identified in the latest automated baseline configuration
Target:
X % or higher, 
X % higher than previous period, 
X % increase over a defined period 

Higher is better
Comment: Refer NIST SP 800-53 Controls – CM-2: Baseline Configuration and CM-3: Configuration Change Control
Source: NIST: SP 800-55 Revision 1, Performance Measurement Guide for Information Security

MetricDescription: % information systems that have conducted annual contingency plan testing
Target:
X % or higher, 
X % higher than previous period, 
X % increase over a defined period 

Higher is better
Source: NIST: SP 800-55 Revision 1, Performance Measurement Guide for Information Security

MetricDescription: % incidents reported within required time frame per applicable incident category
Target:
X % or higher, 
X % higher than previous period, 
X % increase over a defined period 

Higher is better
Source: NIST: SP 800-55 Revision 1, Performance Measurement Guide for Information Security

MetricDescription: % physical security incidents allowing unauthorized entry into facilities containing information systems
Target:
X or lower, 
X % lower than previous period, 
X % reduction over a defined period 

Lower is better
Comment: Refer: NIST SP 800-53 Control – PE-6: Monitoring Physical Access
Source: NIST: SP 800-55 Revision 1, Performance Measurement Guide for Information Security

X % or higher,

X % or higher,
